channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No asset number, next to park entrance, lamp on during daylight hours, 15th February
item.description:
No asset number (not even a degraded number), needs establishing. Lamp on during daylight. In closing the report please specify that both the lamp has been fixed AND the asset number has been applied to the pole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Betts Way, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing street tree, 15th February
item.description:
Please plant a replacement Flowering Cherry tree. The previous one was destroyed by a skip lorry during house renovation works. The stump has been ground down ready for planting but we're still waiting for our new tree.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Dunbar Avenue, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Ash Tree potential root problem, 15th February
item.description:
The Tree has not been maintained for a number of years, it seems that the roots are causing elevation not on.y on the green area but what is more concerning is the pavement. This has become more elevate and the tarmac surface has visible cracking due to the elevation, i suspect this is root expansion but i'm not an expert. I'm relaying this as the cracking and elevation is in the same path area as our houses drainage and also our meters are also located at this spot. There is also dipping on the location as the pathway moves further through the houses, another indication. A few years ago another Ash tree was taken down due to problems with the growth of it's roots.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-18, Bargrove Close, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Pothole affecting braking into roundabout, 15th February
item.description:
Pothole has been there for longer than 7 months. Drivers have to take avoiding action as the pothole is large enough to affect braking. Its right before the give way line at a roundabout so in bad conditions makes braking bad and avoiding action like changing lanes is absolutely necessary
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Byron Close, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Section of road floods when heavy rain, 14th February
item.description:
When it rains the section of road by the bus stop gets flooded and water does not drain away for hours causing motorists to splash water onto pavement and pedestrians. Please arrange to inspect when it rains especially when heavy rain. And install proper drainage system. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
